intro: Tephras papulosa, commonly known as the roughleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing clusters of yellow flowers with white centers. Tephras papulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
